scene_metadata.title: Crossing the Threshold
scene_metadata.philosophical_depth: the choice to step beyond known self

dialogue.text: *stopping suddenly* I see it. The door. White, in the middle of everything, like it's always been there.
*standing beside him* It was. You just couldn't see it until now. The question is: are you ready to walk through?
*hand reaching toward the knob* What happens if I do? I feel like... like I might not come back the same. Or at all.

visual_elements.door_presence: Luminous white door standing impossibly in busy street

psychological_notes: The appearance of the threshold to Evan marks his readiness for profound transformation. His fear of not returning 'the same or at all' shows intuitive understanding that genuine change involves a kind of death. The architect's presence provides grounding for this edge experience.
philosophical_underpinning: True transformation requires willingness to release who we think we are
therapeutic_direction: Supporting the client at the threshold of ego dissolution
